I recommend the application for learning Arabic verb conjugations: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.apakhun.arabicverbstestssecond

The recommended order of learning:

 1) Acquaintance with the grammar table Assimilated (similar to regular) verb: tense (past, present, future), masculine or feminine, quantitative (singularity, duality and plurality), and most importantly the rule of appending to the origin verb (these are red colored) 

 2) Learning of the past tense conjugation in active and passive forms. Passing of the first verb without any errors.

 3) Learning of the present tense conjugation in active and passive forms. Passing of the first verb without any errors.

 4) Learning of the future and imperative tenses conjugation. Passing of the first verb without any errors.

 After these steps, you can start testing the rest of the Assimilated (similar to regular) verbs. Then, after their 100% passing, you can test other types of verbs.
